alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Adams, central Lincoln and northeastern Grant Counties through 115 PM PDT... At 1244 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 26 miles west of Davenport, or 39 miles northeast of Moses Lake, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Odessa, Wilbur, Harrington, Almira, Creston, Mohler, Marcellus, Tokio, Govan, Coffeepot Lake, Lamona, Telford, Rocklyn, and Bluestem. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 229 and 233. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 210 and 254. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
